NOTE: Don't confuse with {AccessControlUnauthorizedAccount}."}],"AccessControlUnauthorizedAccount(address,bytes32)":[{"details":"The `account` is missing a role."}],"ECDSAInvalidSignature()":[{"details":"The signature derives the `address(0)`."}],"ECDSAInvalidSignatureLength(uint256)":[{"details":"The signature has an invalid length."}],"ECDSAInvalidSignatureS(bytes32)":[{"details":"The signature has an S value that is in the upper half order."}]},"events":{"EIP712DomainChanged()":{"details":"MAY be emitted to signal that the domain could have changed."},"RoleAdminChanged(bytes32,bytes32,bytes32)":{"details":"Emitted when `newAdminRole` is set as ``role``'s admin role, replacing `previousAdminRole` `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE` is the starting admin for all roles, despite {RoleAdminChanged} not being emitted to signal this."},"RoleGranted(bytes32,address,address)":{"details":"Emitted when `account` is granted `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call. This account bears the admin role (for the granted role). Expected in cases where the role was granted using the internal {AccessControl-_grantRole}."},"RoleRevoked(bytes32,address,address)":{"details":"Emitted when `account` is revoked `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call:   - if using `revokeRole`, it is the admin role bearer   - if using `renounceRole`, it is the role bearer (i.e. `account`)"}},"kind":"dev","methods":{"constructor":{"details":"Constructor to initialize the CredentialManager with the DIDManager address. Grants DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE and GOVERNMENT_ROLE to the deployer. Initializes the EIP-712 domain with name \"CredentialManager\" and version \"1\".","params":{"didManagerAddress":"The address of the deployed DIDManager contract."}},"dualHash(bytes)":{"details":"Combines keccak256 and SHA-256 for dual hashing.","params":{"data":"The data to be hashed."},"returns":{"keccakHash":"The keccak256 hash of the data.","sha256Hash":"The SHA-256 hash of the data."}},"eip712Domain()":{"details":"returns the fields and values that describe the domain separator used by this contract for EIP-712 signature."},"getIssuedTimestamp(string)":{"details":"Returns the issuance timestamp of a credential.","params":{"id":"The credential ID."},"returns":{"_0":"The timestamp when the credential was issued. === NEW CODE: No changes needed; helper function remains unchanged. ==="}},"getRoleAdmin(bytes32)":{"details":"Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}."},"grantRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event."},"hasRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Returns `true` if `account` has been granted `role`."},"issueVerifiableCredential(string,string,string,uint256,string[],string[],string,string)":{"details":"Issues a new verifiable credential. Requires GOVERNMENT_ROLE.","params":{"context":"The context array for the credential.","credentialType":"The type array for the credential.","data":"The credential data.","expiresAt":"The expiration timestamp of the credential.","id":"The unique ID of the credential.","proofCreator":"The creator of the proof. === NEW CODE: Clarification === This function now verifies the subject DID via the DIDManager's isVerified function.","proofType":"The type of proof.","subject":"The DID of the subject."}},"renounceRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"revokeCredential(string)":{"details":"Revokes a verifiable credential. Requires GOVERNMENT_ROLE.","params":{"id":"The ID of the credential to revoke. === NEW CODE: No changes needed; revocation logic remains intact. ==="}},"revokeRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"signCredential(string,bytes)":{"details":"Adds a digital signature to a verifiable credential. Requires GOVERNMENT_ROLE.","params":{"id":"The ID of the credential to sign.","signature":"The digital signature to attach to the credential. === NEW CODE: No changes needed; signing logic remains intact. ==="}},"supportsInterface(bytes4)":{"details":"See {IERC165-supportsInterface}."},"validateDIDCredential(string,string)":{"details":"Validates a DID credential by verifying its signature and associated role.","params":{"credentialId":"The ID of the credential to validate.","requiredRole":"The required role for validation."},"returns":{"isValid":"True if the credential is valid. === NEW CODE: Note that this function uses AccessControl's hasRole on the issuer. You might consider integrating DIDManager.validateDIDRole if you prefer centralized DID role checks. For now, it checks that the issuer (msg.sender when issuing) has the required role. ==="}},"validateVerifiableCredential(string)":{"details":"Validates a verifiable credential by checking its existence, expiry, and signature.","params":{"id":"The ID of the credential to validate."},"returns":{"_0":"isValid True if the credential is valid. === NEW CODE: No changes needed here; function aligns with the overall design. ==="}},"verifyIPFSHash(bytes,bytes32)":{"details":"Verifies an IPFS hash using dual-hashing mechanisms.","params":{"dualHashCombination":"The combined hash (keccak256 and SHA-256).","ipfsHash":"The IPFS hash to verify."},"returns":{"isValid":"True if the hash matches."}}},"title":"CredentialManager","version":1},"userdoc":{"kind":"user","methods":{},"notice":"This contract manages the lifecycle of verifiable credentials, including issuing, validating, signing, and revoking them. It integrates with a DIDManager contract to verify the existence of Decentralized Identifiers (DIDs) and includes enhanced IPFS hash verification. ## Features - Credential Lifecycle Management: Issue, validate, and revoke verifiable credentials. - DID Integration: Verifies the existence of DIDs via the DIDManager. - Enhanced Security: Uses dual-hashing (keccak256 and SHA-256) for improved interoperability and integrity. - Role-Based Access Control: Uses AccessControl to enforce permissions. - Event Logging: Emits events for credential issuance, revocation, and signing. ## Roles - `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE`: Full administrative access. - `GOVERNMENT_ROLE`: Authority to issue, revoke credentials, and manage IPFS hash verification. ## Usage - Issue a Credential via `issueVerifiableCredential` - Validate via `validateVerifiableCredential` or `validateDIDCredential` - Revoke using `revokeCredential` - Manage IPFS hashes with `addVerifiedIPFSHash` - Sign credentials using `signCredential` ## Note on Multi-Tenancy Credential data is treated as global (i.e. not partitioned by tenant) since the subject DID is verified via the DIDManager, which itself is global. If needed, further tenant\u2010based restrictions can be added.","version":1}},"settings":{"compilationTarget":{"src/managers/CredentialManager.sol":"CredentialManager"},"evmVersion":"shanghai","libraries":{},"metadata":{"bytecodeHash":"ipfs"},"optimizer":{"enabled":true,"runs":200},"remappings":[":@openzeppelin/contracts/=lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/",":ds-test/=lib/solmate/lib/ds-test/src/",":erc4626-tests/=lib/openzeppelin-contracts/lib/erc4626-tests/",":forge-std/=lib/forge-std/src/",":halmos-cheatcodes/=lib/openzeppelin-contracts/lib/halmos-cheatcodes/src/",":openzeppelin-contracts/=lib/openzeppelin-contracts/",":solmate/=lib/solmate/src/"],"viaIR":true},"sources":{"lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/access/AccessControl.sol":{"keccak256":"0xc1bebdee8943bd5e9ef1e0f2e63296aa1dd4171a66b9e74d0286220e891e1458","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://928cf2f0042c606f3dcb21bd8a272573f462a215cd65285d2d6b407f31e9bd67","dweb:/ipfs/QmWGxjckno6sfjHPX5naPnsfsyisgy4PJDf46eLw9umfpx"]},"lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/access/IAccessControl.sol":{"keccak256":"0x4d9a2b261b56a1e4a37bb038151dec98b952fed16de2bdfdda27e38e2b12b530","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://f724110f7aeb6151af800ab8c12e6060b29bda9e013f0ccb331eb754d6a7cbf0","dweb:/ipfs/QmUcjzCZpxtUPdEThtAzE1f9LvuJiUGZxTdH9N6bHrb5Cf"]},"lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/interfaces/IERC5267.sol":{"keccak256":"0x92aa1df62dc3d33f1656d63bede0923e0df0b706ad4137c8b10b0a8fe549fd92","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://c5c0f29195ad64cbe556da8e257dac8f05f78c53f90323c0d2accf8e6922d33a","dweb:/ipfs/QmQ61TED8uaCZwcbh8KkgRSsCav7x7HbcGHwHts3U4DmUP"]},"lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/utils/Context.sol":{"keccak256":"0x493033a8d1b176a037b2cc6a04dad01a5c157722049bbecf632ca876224dd4b2","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://6a708e8a5bdb1011c2c381c9a5cfd8a9a956d7d0a9dc1bd8bcdaf52f76ef2f12","dweb:/ipfs/Qmax9WHBnVsZP46ZxEMNRQpLQnrdE4dK8LehML1Py8FowF"]},"lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/utils/Panic.sol":{"keccak256":"0xf7fe324703a64fc51702311dc51562d5cb1497734f074e4f483bfb6717572d7a","li ":["bzz-raw://fa13f6a4e21f0ef45cbcdc6d1058ae5a09b81364fbae521adb37db4f8e802d7f","dweb:/ipfs/QmYF1LgoF6uwNHXcyQrq8WEYRCtPtcrrGTRXYDRiBaJ9Ys"]},"src/libraries/SharedStructs.sol":{"keccak256":"0x15f7a25d927200b51ea16e844c812dbd57933b4e6dfbb46182877926f2ecdc88","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://b7873b9442ef34543dbf26e8e676c19fcf91e2b34ba27c6e38cf9241b102e731","dweb:/ipfs/QmXazwuzdVgLPBzrm71atzucCzwebzHAriXEWPT76n68yL"]},"src/managers/CredentialManager.sol":{"keccak256":"0x1f08ac6be2987481100c96c2fbcce30433d92f625007ba8432e6f2ccc2374ef5","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://79f3db6aecce350898e598cac87fa8b700999063c04aef4a391a9f00795083d5","dweb:/ipfs/QmYcZ8tsntqFuxc3JJgsQS8eAcRZtVcBP4ASwpXzuexwxo"]}},"version":1}

constructor.details: Constructor to initialize the CredentialManager with the DIDManager address. Grants DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE and GOVERNMENT_ROLE to the deployer. Initializes the EIP-712 domain with name "CredentialManager" and version "1".

params.didManagerAddress: The address of the deployed DIDManager contract.

dualHash(bytes).details: Combines keccak256 and SHA-256 for dual hashing.

returns.keccakHash: The keccak256 hash of the data.
returns.sha256Hash: The SHA-256 hash of the data.

eip712Domain().details: returns the fields and values that describe the domain separator used by this contract for EIP-712 signature.

getIssuedTimestamp(string).details: Returns the issuance timestamp of a credential.

returns._0: The timestamp when the credential was issued. === NEW CODE: No changes needed; helper function remains unchanged. ===

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

issueVerifiableCredential(string,string,.details: Issues a new verifiable credential. Requires GOVERNMENT_ROLE.

params.context: The context array for the credential.
params.credentialType: The type array for the credential.
params.expiresAt: The expiration timestamp of the credential.
params.id: The unique ID of the credential.
params.proofCreator: The creator of the proof. === NEW CODE: Clarification === This function now verifies the subject DID via the DIDManager's isVerified function.
params.subject: The DID of the subject.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeCredential(string).details: Revokes a verifiable credential. Requires GOVERNMENT_ROLE.

params.id: The ID of the credential to revoke. === NEW CODE: No changes needed; revocation logic remains intact. ===

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

signCredential(string,bytes).details: Adds a digital signature to a verifiable credential. Requires GOVERNMENT_ROLE.

params.id: The ID of the credential to sign.
params.signature: The digital signature to attach to the credential. === NEW CODE: No changes needed; signing logic remains intact. ===

validateDIDCredential(string,string).details: Validates a DID credential by verifying its signature and associated role.

params.credentialId: The ID of the credential to validate.

returns.isValid: True if the credential is valid. === NEW CODE: Note that this function uses AccessControl's hasRole on the issuer. You might consider integrating DIDManager.validateDIDRole if you prefer centralized DID role checks. For now, it checks that the issuer (msg.sender when issuing) has the required role. ===

validateVerifiableCredential(string).details: Validates a verifiable credential by checking its existence, expiry, and signature.

params.id: The ID of the credential to validate.

returns._0: isValid True if the credential is valid. === NEW CODE: No changes needed here; function aligns with the overall design. ===

verifyIPFSHash(bytes,bytes32).details: Verifies an IPFS hash using dual-hashing mechanisms.
